p: In this study, 27 out of the 54 strains possessed at least one of the test genes. Among the 54 antagonistic strains examined, 4 (7.4 %), 21 (38.9 %), and 15 (27.8 %) were identified as positive of PKS I, PKS II, and NRPS encoding genes, respectively, in the PCR reactions ( Table 5). PKS-II (25.9%) and NRPS (24.1%) genes exhibited a high positive rate in the members of Streptomyces, while that of PKS-I genes was higher in rare actinobacteria (5.6%).
